docs:
# Connecting the OneNote service to Integromat

To connect your OneNote account to Integromat, follow the general instructions for [Connecting to services](https://support.integromat.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001990194.html#create-a-connection). After you click the **Continue** button, you will be prompted to sign in to your Microsoft account.

![Creating a connection](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009137094/file.png)

![Microsoft login](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009137114/file.png)

If everything went right, the connection is now established and you can finish your integration.

updateAPage.name: updateAPage
updateAPage.label: Update a Page

spec.help:
◉ `#{data-id}` - This `ID` is optionally defined on elements in the input HTML when creating a page or updating a page. Prefix the value with a `#`.
Example: `'#intro'` targets the element `<div data-id="intro" ...>`
◉ `id` - this is the generated `ID` from Microsoft Graph, and is required for most `replace` operations. Do not prefix with a `#`.
Example: `'div:{33f8a2...}{37}'` targets the element `<div id="div:{33f8a2...}{37}" ...>`
◉ `body` - the keyword that targets the `first div` on the page. Do not prefix with a `#`.
◉ `title` - the keyword that targets the page `title`. Do not prefix with a `#`.
spec.name: target
spec.label: Target

spec.help:
◉ `Append` - adds the supplied content to the target as a first or last child, as determined by the `position` attribute.
◉ `Applies` only to `body`, `div`, `ol`, and `ul` elements.
◉ `Insert` - adds the supplied content as a sibling before or after the target, as determined by the `position` attribute.
◉ `Prepend` - adds the supplied content to the target as a first child. Shortcut for `append + before`. Applies only to `body`, `div`, `ol`, and `ul` elements.
◉ `Replace` - replaces the target with the supplied content. Most `replace` actions require using the `generated ID` for the target (except `img` and `object` elements within a `div`, which also support using `data-id`).
◉ `Remove` - removes the selected `target`.
spec.name: action
spec.label: Action

nested.help:
After (default).
With `append`: The last child of the target element.
With `insert`: The subsequent sibling of the target element.
nested.name: position
nested.label: Position

nested.help: ◉ Supported elements: - `body` (targets first div on the page) (`Replace` - no, `Append child` - yes, `Insert sibling` - no) - `div` ([absolute positioned](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/onenote-abs-pos)) (`Replace` - no, `Append child` - yes, `Insert sibling` - no) - `div` (within a `div`) (`Replace` - yes (id only), `Append child` - yes, `Insert sibling` - yes) - `img`, `object` (within a `div`) (`Replace` - yes, `Append child` - no, `Insert sibling` - yes) - `ol`, `ul` (`Replace` - yes (id only), `Append child` - yes, `Insert sibling` - yes) - `table` (`Replace` - yes (id only), `Append child` - no, `Insert sibling` - yes) - `p`, `li`, `h1-h6` (`Replace` - yes (id only), `Append child` - no, `Insert sibling` - yes) - `title` - (`Replace` - yes, `Append child` - no, `Insert sibling` - no). ◉ You can upload images or attachments with **Files** parameter. In order to show them on an updated page, here are two methods below: - For uploading an image, - For uploading an attachment,
nested.name: content
nested.label: Content

onenote.name: onenote
onenote.label: OneNote

scopes.User.Read: Allows users to sign-in to the app, and allows the app to read the profile of signed-in users. It also allows the app to read basic company informatin of signed-in users.
scopes.Notes.Create: Allows the app to read the titles of OneNote notebooks and sections and to create new pages, notebooks, and sections on behalf of the signed-in user.
scopes.Notes.Read.All: Allows the app to read OneNote notebooks that the signed-in user has access to in the organization.
scopes.offline_access: Allows the app to work with your data until you unauthorize it.
scopes.Notes.ReadWrite.All: Allows the app to read, share, and modify OneNote notebooks that the signed-in user has access to in the organization.

onenote.scopesJsonc:
{
    "User.Read": "Allows users to sign-in to the app, and allows the app to read the profile of signed-in users. It also allows the app to read basic company informatin of signed-in users.",
    "Notes.Create": "Allows the app to read the titles of OneNote notebooks and sections and to create new pages, notebooks, and sections on behalf of the signed-in user.",
    "Notes.Read.All": "Allows the app to read OneNote notebooks that the signed-in user has access to in the organization.",
    "offline_access": "Allows the app to work with your data until you unauthorize it.",
    "Notes.ReadWrite.All": "Allows the app to read, share, and modify OneNote notebooks that the signed-in user has access to in the organization."
}
